item.title: Frontend Dogma’s Global RSS Feed Is Now a Paid Feature
item.content:encoded:
TL;DR: Access to Frontend Dogma’s main feed now requires a small maintenance fee of $12 per year.

Over the years, Frontend Dogma has become one of the main sources of frontend development news and tools. Frontend Dogma’s growing archives provide unique access to the history of the wider field of web development.

Providing this service for free is not sustainable, however. Book sales pay for some of the work, but so far, few people acknowledge Frontend Dogma’s value by supporting the project on Open Collective.

Starting today, the global RSS feed (with the 250 newest articles and videos) is a paid feature.

You can get access by a small maintenance contribution of only $12 per year.

If you don’t like to support Frontend Dogma, you can still follow Frontend Dogma’s individual topic feeds as well as Frontend Dogma’s social media accounts on Mastodon and Bluesky. These are less convenient and reliable but still workable options to stay up-to-date.

Also, if you want to support Frontend Dogma in a different manner and so that the main feed may be made free again, consider buying Frontend Dogma’s books or contributing to the project on Open Collective. You’re not alone: We do the same for the projects we use and like. Thank you.
